intro: Korthalsella cylindrica var. planiuscula, commonly known as the flat-leafed korthalsella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
